TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {21400=2012 Played in 16 games as a freshman, including making three starts … Totaled one hit, two RBI and three walks in 15 at-bats … Spent the majority of his time as a pinch hitter, while also seeing action at catcher and third base … Finished with a .067 batting average and .222 on-base percentage … Recorded 16 putouts and one assists, while making two errors … Notched his first career hit April 15 as a pinch-hitter against Washington College … Talied his first career RBI March 5 with an RBI groundout against Gordon College … Recorded a walk and an RBI April 29 against Endicott College … Played in the Tri-County Baseball League over the summer., 20121=2013 Stepped into the starting catcher role and became one of the top bats in the UMass Boston lineup … Finished first amongst all sophomores with 37 starts and 38 appearances … Led the Beacons with a .324 batting average (44-for-136), hits (44) and doubles (eights) … Ended the year second on the team with two home runs, 21 RBI, 58 total bases and a .426 slugging percentage … Swiped six stolen bases in six attempts … Registered a .384 on-base percentage … Ended the year with the second-most putouts on the team (195) and a .974 fielding percentage … Recorded a 12-game hitting streak from March 17 to April 7 … Helped the Beacons sweep Little East rival UMass Dartmouth by finishing 4-for-9 with three runs, two RBI and his first career home run on March 30 … Recorded a season-high three RBI in a 4-1 win at Babson College on April 11 … Went 3-for-3 with two runs scored and an RBI in the first game of a doubleheader sweep over Plymouth State on April 27 … Belted the game-winning home run and totaled three hits and three RBI May 8 in a Little East Conference Tournament victory over Keene State College … Spent the summer playing for the Wachusetts Dirt Dawgs of the Future Collegiate Baseball League.      , 22087=PERSONAL/HIGH SCHOOL Graduated from Westfield High School in 2011 where he was a member of the baseball team ... Named an All-Western Mass. First Team selection ... Named the MVP of the West vs. Central Senior All-Star game ... Selected to the Massachusetts High School All-Star team ... Born on April 21, 1993 ... Sone of Todd and Debra Ezold ... Has two siblings, Sydney and Taylor ... Currently majoring in management.}
